thread.title: Local athletes in college: Oct. 20, 2015 - Local Athletes in College
thread.title_full: Local athletes in college: Oct. 20, 2015 - Local Athletes in College - NorthJersey.com

author: JOHN ROWE
title: Local athletes in college: Oct. 20, 2015 - Local Athletes in College
text:
Malik Bakker, Matt Hennessy, William Mack III, Mike Maletta, Don Bosco; Gene Coleman, Bergen Catholic; Terrell Vassell, Depaul
Urban Meyer, Jim Harbaugh and Kyle Flood aren’t the only college football coaches trying to recruit top talent from North Jersey’s parochial powers.
Army coach Jeff Monken and his staff are constantly crossing the state line in search of top players.
Six seniors from the parochial teams have received offers from Army and five others had offers before verbally committing to other schools.
The players with offers include running back Malik Bakker, offensive lineman Matt Hennessy, defensive tackle William Mack III, and center Mike Maletta, all from Don Bosco; Bergen Catholic wide receiver Gene Coleman, and DePaul cornerback Terrell Vassell.
Maletta also has an offer from Air Force; Coleman is being recruited by Syracuse, Connecticut and Buffalo, and Temple, Old Dominion and Massachusetts are pursuing Vassell.
Those who were on Army’s radar before committing elsewhere were: Don Bosco cornerback Tyrone Hill, who committed to Maryland and had an offer from Navy; Bergen Catholic defensive end Sal Mauro, who committed to Delaware; Don Bosco defensive end-linebacker Brandon Simon, who committed to Iowa and had an offer from Boston College; Paramus Catholic offensive lineman Daniel Zapata, who committed to Liberty; and DePaul defensive lineman Michael Dwumfour, who committed to Penn State.
John Trainor, Harrington Park
* John Trainor, a sophomore from Harrington Park, carried only once in Army’s 21-14 win over Bucknell on Saturday, but he gained 22 yards. On the season, the former NV/Old Tappan standout has carried 20 times for 195 yards and one touchdown. He’s also caught four passes for 72 yards.
Devin Fuller, Norwood
* Devin Fuller, a senior from Norwood who played at NV/Old Tappan, amassed a team-high 172 all-purpose yards in UCLA’s 56-35 loss to Stanford. Fuller had four receptions for 44 yards and returned six kickoffs for 128 yards, including a top return of 30 yards.
Matt Ambrose, Wyckoff
* Matt Ambrose, a senior linebacker from Wyckoff who played at Ramapo, was a major contributor to Cortland State’s 20-14 victory over Alfred. Ambrose, credited with 10 tackles, came up with a first-down sack with less than a minute to go. Alfred then threw three straight incompletions, the final two into the end zone, before turning the ball over on downs with 18 seconds remaining.
Jonathan Germano, Hawthorne
* Jonathan Germano, a junior from Hawthorne who played at Bergen Catholic, threw for 269 yards and four touchdowns as Johns Hopkins routed Dickinson, 34-7. Johns Hopkins, the eighth-ranked Division III team in the country, has won 27 consecutive regular-season games.
Frank Failace, Wayne
* Frank Failace, a redshirt junior and a three-year starting tight end from Wayne who played at Don Bosco, had three touchdown receptions as St. Francis (Pa.) beat Wagner, 43-14. He set a school single-game record for TD catches by a tight end.
LeRon Dillard, Rutherford
* LeRon Dillard, a junior defensive back from Rutherford, had 10 tackles as Kean lost to Wesley College, the fourth-ranked Division III team, 56-14.
